subject: Photography
title: The Economics of Photography
description: A 60-second lesson on The Economics of Photography.

hook.text: A wedding photographer earns thousands per event. A stock photographer earns pennies per download. Same craft, wild gap.

buildup.text: Photography's economics vary wildly: commercial, editorial, stock, fine art, and events each pay very differently.

discovery.text: Digital technology lowered barriers to entry. More photographers means more competition and downward price pressure.

twist.text: The smartphone means everyone is a photographer. Professional photographers must now sell expertise, not just images.

climax.text: Photography's value has shifted from the image itself to the experience, branding, and exclusivity around it.

punchline.text: Everyone can take photos. Few can make a living from them.

quiz.question: How has digital technology affected professional photography economics?
options: Lower barriers to entry increased competition and reduced prices
It made all photography more expensive
